title: What should I do if I am bored and lonely? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi there! I remember going through a similar phase at that age (like it was even that long ago, haha). What helps: 1. finding an interest, Is there something you’re currently interested in? It could be sports, language, any (safe!) activity, really. If not, is there anything that you’re curious about? It becomes easier to build connections and bond with people around you if you guys share common interests. You can casually bring it up in conversation - “Oh, you like XXX too? Me too! I really like how …” You can use shared interests to build up. 2. consider perhaps joining a charity, club or volunteering for a cause that touches you (orphanage, pet shelter, hospice, etc), This can be a little tricky if you’ve got school eating up most of your time or have parents that are a little strict on letting you go out and about. But, such places can be a great place to meet people who you can really click with and perhaps even become good friends with. If you’re the kind that gets a little awkward around people (or are a little shy), it can be a tad difficult to put yourself out there. Fake it till you make it. Most people can’t tell the difference. 3. break-break-break out of your comfort zone! It’s very easy to fall into seclusion if you’re the kind of person who’s gets anxious in new situations and around new people. It can be really daunting. But most times, our minds say things that can keep us from breaking out of the little box we’re comfortable in. Spoiler: most times, our minds are wrong. Try to keep an open mind when it comes to trying out new things. You never knoowwww 4. stay healthy! I cannot stress this enough. When we don’t take care of our bodies, it does whack WHACK things to our mood. A little exercise (hell, even a walk around the neighbourhood counts!) and a healthy diet can really lift up the spirits. You’d be surprised the difference it can make. Also: Get your sunlight in too. Maybe try to catch the sunrise every now and then, there’s something… magical about that sight. 4.5-ish. Stay in drugs! Don’t do school! Okay, but like switch those two up. Stay in school, and don’t do drugs. Seriously. Don’t. Nothing good ever comes out of it. Don’t let the feelings you’re experiencing at this vital stage in your life ever lead you down the path to drugs. While the highs may be thrilling and the world may seem right, all they are is a plaster on a crack of a wall. Any feelings you had before them will just come back (sometimes stronger) after the high is gone. On the matter of school: at least get the basics down. Better safe than sorry. All that being said, A little teen angst is perfectly normal. Puberty’s a mess really, our bodies are adjusting to the mess of hormonal “everything”s that are going on inside them. I’m still growing out of it myself, really. Take care of yourself, put yourself out there and fake it till you make it. :) Sending love and good vibes down your way!

I don’t know whether I’m qualified to answer this question, but I have been lonely in my life, and I’ll share 2 thoughts that have come up for me. One is that you need to cultivate being self-sufficient. One can be alone without being lonely. You can’t control other people, but you can take control of your own life, and do things that interest you and are important to you. You have a unique combination of traits and abilities; if you follow these, doing the things that matter to you, then you will be actualizing yourself. People who do this are interesting and magnetic, but even if this doesn’t draw other people to you, you are fulfilling your mission in life, which is an excellent thing to do. Instead of wishing for companionship, focus on your goals and working toward them. Next: you may be a shy person. If so, you may not realize that shy people often have an unapproachable appearance, due to their fear of interacting with others. If you’re shy, or even if you’re not especially, make a conscious effort to open up to people around you. This doesn’t mean striking up conversations; it means deliberately having a friendly attitude and thinking well of the people around you, whoever they are. If you can, actually wish happiness for the people around you. Become a beacon of positivity moving through the world. The idea is to care more and more for other people. For there is an old spiritual saying: if you want to be happy, think about others; if you want to be miserable, think about yourself. Even if you don’t have companionship in your life right now, you can think about others and care about them, and wish them well. You might even do what you can to help them. And, since people are drawn to positive people, you may find that you have companions before long. But even if you don’t, you’re doing something positive and worthwhile, and you’re living a good life. That’s what I would advise.

Honestly, I get this way quite a lot because I have very few local friends and the ones that I do have I haven’t known long. Essentially, it comes down to I don’t have anyone to talk to or spend time with here in the local area. It has been that way for a long time. Making friends in your mid-40’s is not an easy task. So, for the actual question… What do I do? It has changed a lot in the last six months since becoming more active on Quora. I used to spend hours scrolling through Facebook past the same dozen or so clickbait articles. I’m not saying what I do now is much better because I still waste way too much time on social media, just now it’s writing on Quora. I read a lot too but mostly, I write. I’m not really a fan of television and I don’t really watch much tv, if any at all, while home alone. I do listen to music, pretty much at a constant. There’s always plenty to do and I really have no reason to be actually bored but sometimes being around all the things I should be doing all day, every day, has a paralyzing effect on motivation. I know what I should be doing but instead I’m just looking at it instead of doing it. Don’t get me wrong, I stay plenty active and get a lot done pretty much every day but I always know I could be doing more. It’s exhausting at times to see it all, all around me. To any of my Quora friends reading this, know that I appreciate you and the time you take to talk to me. It helps the loneliness. To some people, online friends may not be as much “friend” as those they know in person. For me, this is not and never has been true. My online friends help keep me sane. So thank you! And thank you for the question!

At first, before reading this answer. You definitely should smile.  Now here you go…💜 1.Go out for coffee.2.Cut a stencil and put a design on an old t-shirt.3.Learn a new recipe.4.Properly fold all of your cloths.5.Find a marker with a blue or green lid and run around pretending it’s a sonic screwdriver.6.Walk to McDonalds and get a McFlurry.7.Organize your iTunes library and make sure everything has album art.8.Start a blog.9.Read through old posts on your favourite blog.10.Have a movie marathon.11.Ride the transit all the way around, until you’re back to where you started.12.Make a friendship bracelet for yourself.13.Shave off all your body hair.14.Go shopping with only ₹100/-.15.Try to invent a new way to play your favourite game.16.Take a really long bath(make sure you don't waste much water ;).17.Sleep well.18.Pretend you’re on a cooking show and talk out loud while cooking.19.Catalogue your home library.20.Go to the library.21.Count all the blue things in your house.22.Build a fort!23.Read a book.24.Reread a favourite line from your favourite books.25.Watch your favourite movie in a different language or on mute with subtitles.26.Go to the store and get all the materials for a craft project.27.Plant a garden.28.Make a YouTube video.29.Teach yourself something really difficult.30.Write a letter, and mail it.31.Write a really nice positive note and put it in a strangers mailbox.32.Take a beer and a bowl of chips and just watch the clouds.33.Do laundry, at a laundromat.34.Make a fake Facebook account ;)35.Bake something from scratch.36.Take photos of interesting sign around your neighbourhood.37.Do you taxes.38.Go through your closet and donate all the cloths you don’t wear anymore to a good cause.39.Take apart your alarm clock.40.Shine you shoes/boots.41.Get a tattoo.42.Buy a new cd.43.Go to a restaurant with a pad and paper and pretend to be a food critic.44.Dust.45.Draw something.46.Dye your hair.47.Learn to swear in a different language.48.See how many pushups/sit-ups you can do.49.Commit yourself to go jogging every day.50.Go out for a drink.51.Learn to make coffee, it takes practice.52.Reorganize you furniture.53.Paint your bed room.54.Look up really ridiculously complex Starbucks orders and memorize them. Then go to Starbucks and try to order them without laughing.55.make crepes.56.Shop online.57.Properly name and organize all the photos on your computer.58.Write a short story.59.Loiter.60.Make up a new identity for yourself.61.Start a collection.62.Pretend to be a tourist and go and do something really touristy.63.Draw on your drive way with chalk.64.Hang out with your mom.65.Go to a movie.66.Join an online community.67.Learn how to make a frappuccino at home.68.Make peach and lime daiquiris.69.Make pressed flowers.70.Learn a new way to lace up your shoes.71.Listen to the radio.72.Get all dressed up to do something really normal, like grocery shopping.73.Try and do everything really quiet, like a ninja.74.Write your autobiography. “You know you’re getting old when you stoop to tie your shoelaces and wonder what else you could do while you’re down there, so my dear friend leave this boredom and live your life to the fullest.” Keep reading 💛🔥 ~CHANU.

I don’t know who you are, what country you live in, or your circumstances. I will tell you this. Use the spare time you have to educate yourself. Read. Read about science, math, engineering, cars, art, history, comics, cooking. Find an interest in something and study it. Get yourself to the level of accomplishment where you can look back and be proud of yourself that you read 12 books in a year. Read books cover to cover. Friends come and go. Knowledge is forever. If after you read a few books, watch films. Watch movies from the 50s or 70s. Watch documenatries. Write about what you watched or what you read. If you feel up for it, join a club. If you are able to meet new people, listen to them. Listen to what they have to say. Try and meet a new person every day. Talk to people you see in bookstores. Being someone who is both an extrovert and an introvert at times I cannot tell you how much of a pleasure it is for me to meet someone who approaches me first and is friendly with me. For me, that happens about 1% of the time I am out in public. 99% of the time I have to be the one to talk to people in a grocery store, a book store, a concert venue, an airport lounge, wherever. Most of the time, there are people who are so caught up in their own lives they don’t even realize there are other people around them. Taking that first step will matter. You are young and certainly capable. Good luck to you.

From a young age I found that your imagination can be quite entertaining no matter where you are and use it all the time whenever I get bored or lonely. The first time I can remember using it to fight boredom was in first grade the class was working on some writing assignment and I was waiting for everyone to finnish. At some point my pencil tip broke and was laying on the desk so thinking it looked kinda like a space ship I pushed it around and through all of the stuff in my desk until everyone else was finished. Another time in school we had a sub and there was no work assigned so it was pretty much a study hall. We obviously would have gotten in trouble for throwing paper balls or flicking paper footballs around so what I did was take an invisible ball out of my pocket and tossed it back and forth with my friends. We would mime out changing it's shape, size, and weight into various things such as frisbees, boomerangs, footballs, and many others. Now that we are pretty much confined to out homes my family is collecting all of the nerf darts and nerf guns we can find and rearranging all the furniture in the basement to make a nerf course. As far as combating loneliness I find that calling someone on the phone or by video chat is the easiest way but if you aren't able to call anyone talking to myself out loud helps sometimes or pretending to talk back to someone on tv can be amusing. Hope this helps!

Best among best to do is sleep! Otherwise what ever u would do when u are bored and lonely you would definitely feel asleep. So good thing would be:- play video gamessports(football)GYM(best thing when lonely or sad or bored)readlisten to songsengage yourself in some other work like in any online course which u love.be with friends, TALK TALK TALK LAUGH LAUGH LAUGHAnd remember some people opt bad ways to overcome it like cigarettes, alcohol and more things. Remember all the time for which u felt bored and lonely it was all because to make u strong to test your limits. When u feel like it just go out in park walk or inhale exhale, or do yoga, hit gym, or so in stadium and do running with full energy, just dont’t think anything just disconnect yourself with everyone for a moment and just love yourself, and for the moment do what u feel like. Do something which u want to do for so long but couldn’t, be free. Never feel bored and lonely dear its just words. And u r human u made these words the people of earth made these words u just don’t have to give importance to them. Just love yourself and make gooood friends. And socialize!!

Go for a walk on busy streets. Watch the crowd chasing nothing peacefully and just smile sarcastically. Check contact list and try calling people who understand me, and as usual none pick up (busy you know!). Just take out all white sheets and paints and brushes and paint heartful. Paint the pain. Talk to my grandparents and ask them about ancestral history. Sleep till my body starts paining maintaining constant posture. Then adjust myself in such a posture that all my muscles are equally stretched, later think, just think on and on (about actually nothing). Stand up on the the street corners and catch kids and ask them weird questions. (hey kid! Did your girlfriend ever hit you? Damn!) Usually my thoughts dive in deep into past and present suggestions on how could I have performed my life issues better. Watch sentimental movies which portray life similar to mine. And imagine myself to be lead artist there. Clean anything that I can put my hands on. (when there's nothing to do then ideas are sent from heaven). Social media is ultimate saviour. Includes stalking people, updating profile, checking recent events etc. Write everything that I feel, criticising each and every person who is involved in making up my boredom. Criticism is all what I can do secretly.

Go out and do something - especially if you live in a town or city. Look up your town/city’s name and see if there are any pet shelters in it or near by. Then go ask whether you can volunteer some extra work - most will be incredibly glad for a pair of extra hands. If you don’t like pets, or if there are no pet shelters, you could go and offer to volunteer to help a homeless charity or a soup-kitchen kind of thing (where they prepare meals for the less fortunate). Maybe you could go out and join an athletics, football, basketball or swim club - anything that has regular meetings. Even if you live in a village, you could still offer to volunteer at your local corner shop. All of these things (and more), not only will cause you to be a bit more active and not as bored, but you will also won’t be feeling as lonely. I’m 15 myself and trust me, there are lots of places that you can go to and help out or clubs you can attend and all of it looks good on your CV later on.

1:Write up one dream per day:Dreaming is a direct line to your passions. Maybe your dreams feel stale, or “good on paper,” but that just means that you haven’t mastered dreaming. Practice makes perfect. Create one dream per day about your troublesome area, and really let yourself day dream about it. For example, I dreamt about living in Canada & Tokyo. This doesn’t mean that I would actually consider living in those places, but it gave me license to just play and get in touch with what I am passionate about in those cities. 2:. You’ve let yourself go: Physically, emotionally or mentally (maybe all three). You stopped doing the things that make you feel like yourself so now you’re stuck feeling like someone else and it’s wearing on you. You haven’t been invigorated in a long time, which is shitting on your creativity – but it’s nobody’s fault except your own.

Do activities you love to do like watching bucketlist movies.Meditate.Sleep.Long walk - short run.Spend time on terrace if the time is suitable.Write something.Start excercise if haven't already.Learn how universe was formed.Learn about stars and planets with star maps or phone apps.Watch Ted-talks and videos on your fave topics.Write some distant friend a letter.Try a new receipee.Grow a plant.Try a new hairstyle.Simply sit back and watch your mind, where it goes, see your thoughts. This is also meditation. Usually most people can't sit back doing nothing, including me. Practice it.
I propose myself… then I reject myself… then I accept myself… just to keep life interesting…! XD

For those who live alone, aside from work, it seems as if there is nothing else left to do when you will get bored. Here is a list of tried-and-tested activities that will surely kick the boredom out of the picture when you’re bored at home alone: 30 Things to Do When You're Bored at Home Alone (see the guide for additional details on the implementation of each of these practices): Make yourself a mealBe your own baristaHave a dance partySing along to your favorite artistsTidy upWash your clothesDeep clean your homeOrganize your closetLearn a musical instrumentEnroll in an online language classFinish your to-read listStart a work-out routineReconnect with longtime friendsInitiate a video call with family or friendsLearn a dance routineBe a baker for a dayRevisit old memoriesMake a photo albumWrite a book reportGet movingPair your socksGet creativeBe a videographerHone your skillsRedecorate your homeTry your hand at origamiPlay gamesTalk to your plantsAttend an online concertStart a gratitude journal

Learn a new language. Duolingo can help with thatWorking out is always good.Allison Courses offers amazing courses and are absolutely free of charge.Make a watchlist and complete it.Reading is amazing too.Start a blog about something you are passionate about or learn something you are really passionate about.

Go to a museum Play paintball Watch a movie Research an interesting topic. Find your old friends on Facebook. Take a one hour introductory flight lesson. Learn Latin. Learn martial arts. Read about Sumer and ancient Egypt. Learn the lyrics of your favorite song. I recommend, “More than a feeling” by Boston. Research music, street bands, and street food from all over the world. Start a meet up group for something unique. Or just camping on We are what we do Volunteer: teach someone how to read. Participate in a church where they have activities for people your age. Take a speed reading class. Go to Barnes N Noble and check out their magazines and games. Become a certified Ufologist and buy some night vision gear to help on your search.

Do you know what interest you?If so you have won your battle 80% and now you find a group around with similar interest and plan some time together in some activities. Soon you will be busy doing something interesting and will have enough plans for future as well. however if you do not know what interest you, you have to find it by participating in different group or by reading different good motivational book. By engaging yourself in these activities you will know where you find satisfaction . Soon your lonely ness will be go far, and you will know the better way of living life. Good wishes to you.

Realise that you only get one life and that if you are lucky enough to have the luxury of time enough to be bored (remembering that no one lives forever of course and we only get a very small amount of time here) and that maybe you should take stock of the things you have in your life as there are some people who have nothing, not even food or clean water or even worse what about people who are unwell! Think about those get off your arse and try and maybe be more grateful for the things you DO have.

How should I avoid feeling lonely and bored? You feel lonely and bored because you allow yourself to be in such stage. Involve yourself in activities which makes you feel connected, which makes you keep going. You can indulge yourself in writing, learning dancing, music, playing instruments etc. You can opt for walks, visiting sites (this is something which you may not be able to do on regular basis but doing it on your weekends too will give you good spirits for whole week & you’ll be inspired for next holidays). You can even watch videos of your interests, read books. Whatever you do, just make sure that doesn’t cross a thrash-hold level. Excess of anything can again take you to boredom since you’ll find yourself too much in a single thing which will make you lose your interest. Just keep on going, keep on exploring yourself. Make a goal of getting your life into a zone where you don’t need a vacation from. Mohit Garg

If you're really bored, you can buy a virtual friend on fiverr.👀You can just shoot the breeze or have an online romance.🌹 In my country, virtual friends are very popular. 💪You can talk to her about your recent troubles, because in real life, few people can accept your negative energy unconditionally.🌈 And because you are strangers, Some sad things you don't want to mention can be casually told to others. 💕Virtual lover is also very popular that you can experience, or simply improve the ability to chat. Of course, it can't involve pornography! （I'm sorry if this sounds like advertising, but my intention is to help people, and due to the epidemic, is boring at home.🙈）

Try gardening, it is really fun. If you don't have have much money, just buy some seeds and put it in the ground and see what happens. Kale is good. It grows in the summer and winter ( unless it is really cold). If your parents give you money, you can buy compost. Watch videos on gardening. Also, cooking and baking is really fun. Take a cooking class, home economics, if it is still offered, in school. If the class is not offered. Watch some youtube videos. You just need to be able to follow directions from recipes that you can do on your own. If you plant carrots, you can make carrot bread. Learn to cook food from different countries.

Train yourself and get better. Exercise regularly. Eat healthy. Sleep well. Lift weights.Read and learn. Know the world. Learn new thing.Know yourself. Know how you feel and why. Understand yourself.Know what you want. Know where you are going. Have dream and goals. Make plans. Work hard.Challenge yourself to do something new.The stronger and better you are, the easiest it is to live and have fun. My2cents

Take charge of your life. Occupy yourself with something. Find a purpose. Do not expect people to fill in that void out for you either. There are so many things to explore/do/learn/relax-enjoy/introspect in todays world…that that alone can fill decades of your life. Find what that is for you, no one can answer those questions on your behalf because at the end of the day you know yourself the best. And if you do not know thyself, start there first and foremost.

You have the answer. You are lonely cuz you are not doing anything. Start new life. Start having a hobby. Discover new things. Learn new things. Keep yourself busy. Gym, sing, learn to cook, drawing, writing blog, youtube channel, online marketing, make new friends, travel, be smart dont get into any foolish things. Keep your self cool you dont need somebody for everything. 24 hours a day is very less to keep it going. All the best dont feel lonely you are with 7billion peoples

Learn how to talk to yourself. I've noticed that there is a “high” you can achieve after engaging in somewhat meaningful conversations with others. For me, it's when the corner of my temple begins to throb. And I have very lucid dreams after this sensation. Must have something to do with manually stimulating your own cerebrum. Pick up skateboarding, learn an instrument; make friends.
Find an activity that allows you to connect with others do something you've never done before hang out with someone you never thought you'd become friends with Take baby steps

Look online to see if there is a little job I could do to bring some extra cash into the home , Sadly asthmatic 68 year olds do not stand much of a chance to find a job that does not require too much daily effort But I still look, If I am sad I think of others who are worse off than myself then feel ashamed for feeling sad.

Write, talk about your feelings. Blog if you want to share them with others. Find something you may enjoy, like joining a book club. There are so many lonely people out there just hopeful that someone comes along interested in them. So, extending yourself to others with a smile or a hello may be the place to start.

I write, whether it be poems, or one liners, or a short story which revolves around the situation which has made me feel lonely. I tear the most of them, and keep one of it safe, so that I can post it on Mirakee or Yourquote so that others can read it as well. Peace! Originally Answered- What do you do when you feel lonely?
Volunteer to assist elderly people. It’ll make you proud of doing something for someone else’s day. It will bring you to another adult that may be lonely too.
Everyone gets bored and lonely; it's a part of life and the feelings are temporary. The best thing to do is to do something you enjoy doing which most likely will lift your mood.

Just do whatever you really like doing.. Talk to people of your taste when you are upset.. Get out of the place where you are and move around where ever possible. I usually eat a lot when I am bored..

Get your game on. Video games can be the perfect way to make a boring day way more exciting. ...Try writing your thoughts down. ...Try painting or drawing. ...Make some music. ...Give your house a makeover. ...Cook up something tasty. ...Watch your favorite movies. ...

Learn new things by watching youtube videos. Self improvement is the vest pass time. Learn a new skill on YouTube for free and apply it in life, you shall never feel bored again. Instead you would feel like a more confident person.
Get a hobby, people tend to bond over similar interests, and whatever hobby you do, make sure you like it so you get involved with people you really like not just for sense of being with someone
Memories make me sad, and the loss of a loved one. Usually I just take a nap. I also read a book, and of course read online everything.
